extendedInfo.description: Browsing the web and want to save a page offline for reading later? Just press Share from your web browser and select Save This Page - the complete page will be saved to your phone and you can view it at any time from the Save This Page app - even when you're not online. Great for reading on the tube or subway!

reviews.title: Essential app
reviews.comment: Every Android I\'ve owned had this app. Useful and handy to be able to store pages on the go; especially when internet signal isn\'t reliable. I\'ve never had a problem with the app. It\'s been fire-and-forget from day one.
reviews.author: John Miller

reviews.title: Great App, only one prob
reviews.comment: This app does everything it says it should. Simple to save, easy to access, and you can rename the pages if you want. The only problem is that you can\'t access the url of the page unless you click \"View online\". Other than that, excellent. --version 2.3 of Motorola Defy and version 2.3 of Lenovo Ideapad. I use it on both of my devices and it works great.
reviews.author: Camille Sibel

reviews.title: I have already saved pages!
reviews.comment: I save them on my PC and copy to android. And I want to read them! But I can\'t! Wery bad! To deleting!

reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
reviews.comment: I used the pocket app a little, but I didn\'t like having to store all my pages on someone else\'s server. I tried using Opera Mini for saving pages too, but I didn\'t like how it saved it into their own format. What I wanted was to be able to save pages into regular html from my phone to transfer to my computer later. This app does that with no problem. The web pages can be retrieved from my SD Card in the phone either manually, or I can easily sync folders using another app. The only thing keeping this from being a 5 Star app is I\'d like it if I could choose the directory the pages get saved to, as well as name the files myself. But, considering this is the only app of its kind available, I\'m happy it does what it does and I can come up with my own work arounds.
reviews.author: Geoff Forbes
